channel.title: Tutorials on Ypertex Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Tutorials on Ypertex Blog
channel.copyright: Original content released under the [CC BY 4.0 International](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/) license

item.title: Integrating Termly With Nuxt 3
item.description: Integrating Termly’s consent management with Nuxt 3 turns out to be harder than just inserting a script tag. Here’s a solution that resolves hydration mismatches and UI glitches, ensuring smooth functionality and user experience.

item.title: Mastering Keyboard Interactions in Shadcn-Vue: A Fix for Complex UIs
item.description: In the intricate dance of UI components within Vue applications, a misstep can disrupt the rhythm. Discover how a straightforward tweak can harmonize your keyboard interactions in shadcn-vue in complex nested components.

item.title: The Better Nuxt Directus Authentication Middleware
item.description: The Nuxt Directus docs give you a basic auth middleware, but it’s got some quirks. Here’s how to bulletproof it.

item.title: Multisource-Multitrack Recording in Your DAW
item.description: Want to patch audio from multiple interfaces through to your digital audio workstation on seperate tracks? Here’s how VoiceMeeter can help.

item.title: Accelerate Your Website---With Your Logo
item.description: Most people who care about their website’s performance probably use a website logo created by vector graphics software. Here’s how to take advantage of vectorized logos to speed up your website. Seriously.

item.title: Useful Hugo Templating
item.description: Developing templates for the static website generator Hugo? Then these advanced tips & tricks might be helpful to you.

item.title: Unhide Virtual Network Adapters in Windows 10
item.description: In Windows’ latest releases, Microsoft hides virtual adapters and networks by default. In some cases though, you need them to be available just like regular adapters and networks.

item.title: Enabling JumpCloud on Unsupported Linux Systems
item.description: JumpCloud officially supports Debian, yet refuses to run on Debian-based systems like Proxmox Virtual Environment and Openmediavault. Let’s fix that.

item.title: How to Advertise Subnets to Upstream Routers with OPNsense and ARP
item.description: If you ever wondered how to split a subnet away from a fixed upstream gateway, hereâ€™s how you can achieve this with ARP in OPNsense.

item.title: Working Around the JumpCloud Curl Error 22
item.description: JumpCloud is a great tool to enable Single Sign-On for whatever devices you have. Find out how to work around curl error 22 to keep using it on Linux.
